Sentence: The superconductor MgB 2 , discovered in 2001 [5], has shown potential for use in SRF cavities.
Structural and elemental analyses showed a uniform MgB 2 coating on top of a Mg-Cu alloy layer with occasional intrusion of Mg-Cu alloy regions.

Combined with its high T c , MgB 2 coatings on Cu cavities may allow operation at 20-25 K using closed- cycle refrigeration, eliminating the need for liquid helium cooling and complicated cryomodules .
High quality MgB 2 films were successfully grown on 2 inch diameter Cu discs with a uniform thickness across the disc.
A sharp decrease in Q above 37 K signals a transition of the MgB 2 film from superconducting to normal state, confirming a T c of 37 K from the DC measurement.
